message_1:
A professor wants to analyze the performance of their students in two different subjects, Math and Science. The professor has recorded the scores of 10 students in each subject. The data is as follows:

Math scores: 75, 86, 92, 68, 80, 90, 78, 82, 85, 90
Science scores: 62, 78, 80, 56, 70, 75, 72, 74, 80, 85

Calculate the covariance between the Math and Science scores.
message_2:
To calculate the covariance between the Math and Science scores, we first need to find the mean of each set of scores.

Mean of Math scores:
(75 + 86 + 92 + 68 + 80 + 90 + 78 + 82 + 85 + 90) / 10 = 826 / 10 = 82.6

Mean of Science scores:
(62 + 78 + 80 + 56 + 70 + 75 + 72 + 74 + 80 + 85) / 10 = 732 / 10 = 73.2

Now, we will calculate the deviations from the mean for each score and multiply them together.

(Math score - Mean of Math scores) * (Science score - Mean of Science scores)

(75 - 82.6) * (62 - 73.2) = -7.6 * -11.2 = 85.12
(86 - 82.6) * (78 - 73.2) = 3.4 * 4.8 = 16.32
(92 - 82.6) * (80 - 73.2) = 9.4 * 6.8 = 63.92
(68 - 82.6) * (56 - 73.2) = -14.6 * -17.2 = 251.12
(80 - 82.6) * (70 - 73.2) = -2.6 * -3.2 = 8.32
(90 - 82.6) * (75 - 73.2) = 7.4 * 1.8 = 13.32
(78 - 82.6) * (72 - 73.2) = -4.6 * -1.2 = 5.52
(82 - 82.6) * (74 - 73.2) = -0.6 * 0.8 = -0.48
(85 - 82.6) * (80 - 73.2) = 2.4 * 6.8 = 16.32
(90 - 82.6) * (85 - 73.2) = 7.4 * 11.8 = 87.32

Now, we will sum up these products and divide by the number of data points (n) minus 1.

Covariance = (85.12 + 16.32 + 63.92 + 251.12 + 8.32 + 13.32 + 5.52 - 0.48 + 16.32 + 87.32) / (10 - 1) = 546.8 / 9 = 60.76

The covariance between the Math and Science scores is 60.76.
